### Data preparation

First, we download the data file and load it into an R object. We're using a `tidyr`-centric approach, leveraging on the full suite of library found in package `tidyverse`.

```{r data-prep}

# Check if data dir exists -> create one
if (!file.exists("data")) {
    dir.create("./data")
}

# Get the data
if (!file.exists("data/stormdata.csv")) {
    download.file("https://d396qusza40orc.cloudfront.net/repdata%2Fdata%2FStormData.csv.bz2", "data/stormdata.csv")
}

data <- read_csv("data/stormdata.csv")

```
